multiple.translation[0].definitions[0].d: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
multiple.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
multiple.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times
multiple.translation[2].definitions[0].d: including or involving many things, people, events etc
multiple.translation[2].definitions[0].e: They are investigating the company for multiple violations of trade-practices law.
They can access multiple databases simultaneously.
multiple.translation[3].definitions[0].d: a number which is the result of multiplying a particular number by another number
multiple.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The bank will offer multiples of up to four times your income  (=will lend you an amount which is up to four times your yearly income).
multiple.translation[3].definitions[1].d: a group or number of a particular product, share etc
multiple.translation[3].definitions[1].e: The shares are sold in multiples of 200.
multiple.translation[3].definitions[2].d: the price of a share divided by its EARNINGS (=share of a companyâ€™s profits for a year)
multiple.translation[3].definitions[2].e: stock that offers low price-earnings multiples, limited risk, and regular dividends
multiple.translation[3].definitions[3].d: the rent that a property produces as an investment in relation to the price paid for it
multiple.translation[3].definitions[4].d: a company that owns shops trading under the same name in many cities, or one of these shops
multiple.translation[3].definitions[4].e: We are taking trade from large multiples where service is poor.
